_meta._purpose: These messages follow OWASP/NIST guidelines to prevent information disclosure. Translations MUST maintain generic wording to prevent credential enumeration and timing attacks. Never reveal: which credential failed, precise timing, account existence, or attack progress.

authentication_failed.security_note: MUST NOT reveal which credential failed (password, OTP, or recovery code). This prevents attackers from determining valid credentials or enumerating accounts.
authentication_failed.owasp_ref: ASVS 2.2.2 - Authentication failure responses must be generic

rate_limited.security_note: MUST NOT reveal precise lockout duration, attempt counts, or remaining attempts. This prevents timing attacks and progress tracking.
rate_limited.owasp_ref: ASVS 2.2.1 - Account lockout must not be timing-based enumerable

session_expired.security_note: Safe to indicate session issue as it doesn't reveal credential information. Helps users understand they need to re-authenticate.

recovery_code_not_found.security_note: Safe to indicate recovery code context as user explicitly selected this authentication method. Does not reveal whether code exists.

recovery_code_used.security_note: Safe expected behavior message. Users need to know recovery codes are single-use to prevent confusion.

MUST_translate_as: Generic rate limit message (no precise timing)
_translation_guidelines.WHY: These restrictions prevent attackers from: (1) determining valid usernames/emails, (2) knowing which credential to focus attacks on, (3) conducting timing attacks, (4) measuring attack progress

_safe_information.format_requirements: Safe to specify format rules (e.g., 'OTP must be 6 digits')
_safe_information.expected_behavior: Safe to describe how features work (e.g., 'Codes expire every 30 seconds')
_safe_information.recovery_options: Safe to offer alternatives (e.g., 'Use a recovery code instead')
_safe_information.general_guidance: Safe to provide help (e.g., 'Check your authenticator app')

web.auth.mfa_required.context: Page heading shown when user must complete MFA to proceed

web.auth.mfa_verification_required.text: MFA verification required to access your account

web.auth.security._guidance.context: ⚠️ SECURITY-CRITICAL: Messages prevent information disclosure. See src/locales/SECURITY-TRANSLATION-GUIDE.md

web.auth.security.authentication_failed.text: Authentication failed. Please verify your credentials and try again.

web.auth.security.rate_limited.text: Too many attempts. Please try again later.

web.auth.security.session_expired.text: Session expired. Please log in again.

web.auth.security.recovery_code_not_foun.text: Recovery code not found. Please verify you entered it correctly.

web.auth.security.recovery_code_used.text: This recovery code has already been used. Each code can only be used once.

web.auth.security.network_error.text: Network error. Please check your connection and try again.

web.auth.security.internal_error.text: An error occurred. Please try again.

web.auth.magicLink.description.text: We'll send you a secure login link

web.auth.magicLink.sentTo.text: We sent a login link to {email}

web.auth.magicLink.linkExpiresIn.text: This link will expire in 15 minutes

web.auth.magicLink.noPasswordNeeded.text: No password needed — just click the link in your email

web.auth.magicLink.requestFailed.text: Failed to send login link. Please try again.

web.auth.magicLink.pleaseWait.text: Please wait while we verify your link

web.auth.webauthn.signIn.text: Sign in with Face ID / Touch ID

web.auth.webauthn.notSupported.text: Biometric authentication is not supported in this browser

web.auth.webauthn.requiresModernBrowser.text: Please use a modern browser that supports WebAuthn (Chrome, Safari, Firefox, or Edge)

web.auth.webauthn.setupFailed.text: Failed to set up biometric login

web.auth.webauthn.authFailed.text: Biometric authentication failed. Please try again.

web.auth.webauthn.description.text: Use your fingerprint, face, or security key to sign in

web.auth.webauthn.supportedMethods.text: Supports Face ID, Touch ID, Windows Hello, and security keys

web.auth.lockout.account_locked.text: Account locked due to too many failed login attempts

web.auth.lockout.contact_support.text: Contact support if you need immediate access

web.auth.lockout.try_password_reset.text: You can reset your password instead

web.auth.sessions.confirm_remove.text: Are you sure you want to remove this session?

web.auth.sessions.confirm_remove_all.text: This will log you out from all other devices. Are you sure?

web.auth.sessions.removed_all_success.text: All other sessions have been logged out

web.auth.mfa.setup_description.text: Add an extra layer of security to your account

web.auth.mfa.scan_qr.text: Scan this QR code with your authenticator app

web.auth.mfa.verify_code.text: Enter the 6-digit code from your app

web.auth.mfa.invalid_code.text: Invalid code. Codes expire every 30 seconds. Try the latest code from your authenticator app.

web.auth.mfa.password_reason.text: Confirm your identity to modify two-factor authentication settings

web.auth.mfa.cancel.text: Cancel and return to sign in

web.auth.mfa.protected_description.text: Your account is protected with two-factor authentication

web.auth.mfa.enable_description.text: Protect your account with an additional layer of security

web.auth.mfa.benefit_unauthorized.text: Prevent unauthorized access even if your password is compromised

web.auth.mfa.benefit_apps.text: Works with Google Authenticator, Authy, and other TOTP apps

web.auth.mfa.benefit_recovery.text: Backup recovery codes for emergency access

web.auth.mfa.supported_apps.text: Use Google Authenticator, Authy, or any TOTP app

web.auth.mfa.enter_code_description.text: Enter the 6-digit code from your authenticator app

web.auth.mfa.enter_recovery_code.text: Enter one of your recovery codes

web.auth.mfa.enter_all_digits.text: Please enter all 6 digits to continue

web.auth.recovery_codes.description.text: Save these codes in a safe place. Each can be used once if you lose access to your authenticator.

web.auth.recovery_codes.warning.text: These codes will only be shown once

web.auth.recovery_codes.save_required.text: You must download or copy your recovery codes before completing setup.

web.auth.recovery_codes.generate_new_war.text: This will invalidate all existing recovery codes

web.auth.recovery_codes.copy_failed.text: Failed to copy codes to clipboard

web.auth.recovery_codes.usage_hint.text: Each code can only be used once. Regenerate codes if you're running low.

web.auth.recovery_codes.generate_success.text: New recovery codes have been generated
